intro: Pratia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Pratia elliptica is often found in sandy or rocky soils in woodland and heathland habitats. It is a perennial shrub that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
